benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

covered: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios cover retrieving custom fields with no parameters and with combinations of objectType, fieldName, and fieldValue (TC01-TC06, TC37).
Empty Response: Empty-database and no-match scenarios covered (TC11, TC28).
Pagination: Offset/limit positive and boundary behaviors covered, including large limit and offset beyond dataset (TC07, TC21, TC22).
Query Parameters: Extensive positive and negative parameter combinations are tested (objectType, fieldName, fieldValue, audit) including invalid values (TC02-TC06, TC13-TC16, TC37).
Authorization: Missing/invalid authentication scenario present (TC17) verifying 401 behavior.
Audit behavior: audit=FULL/MINIMAL/NONE and integrations/unavailability tested (TC08-TC10, TC18, TC32, TC33, TC26).
Error handling & validation: Input validation, SQL injection and XSS attack vectors are tested (TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC19, TC20).
Resilience & performance: Concurrency, heavy load, response-time targets, and recovery are covered (TC23, TC24, TC30, TC31, TC36).
Regression & backward compatibility: Regression tests and legacy-client behavior covered (TC25, TC26, TC27).
Response schema / content type: Several scenarios assert JSON array and CustomField schema conformance (TC01, TC02, etc.).
Accessibility / UX of errors & docs: Documentation and descriptive error message checks are included (TC34, TC35).
gaps: Authorization – insufficient-permission (403) scenarios are missing. The suite only tests missing auth (401) but not authenticated users without privileges (403).
Rate limiting / throttling – no explicit tests verify rate limiting behavior (429) or server behaviour under many rapid requests beyond normal concurrency tests.
Caching behavior / conditional requests – no tests for HTTP caching headers or conditional GETs (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or behavior when responses are cached.

Non-integer / malformed parameter types – tests cover negative/zero and invalid enum values but not non-numeric strings for offset/limit (e.g., offset=abc) or extremely long strings for parameters beyond SQLi/XSS patterns.
Parameter matching semantics – no tests clarify matching semantics for fieldName/fieldValue (exact match vs case-insensitive vs substring).

Pagination defaults & limits – there is no explicit test verifying default limit (100) when limit omitted, or enforcement of a maximum cap if such exists, nor the behavior when limit is omitted with large datasets.

Content negotiation & headers – no tests for Accept/Content-Type header variants or verifying response Content-Type application/json and charset, nor for presence/absence of other relevant response headers.

HTTP method handling – no tests ensure other HTTP methods (POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE) to this endpoint are rejected with appropriate 405/405-like responses (guideline covers methods even if story is GET).
Database state edge-cases – tests cover empty/partial/full DB but not concurrent modifications during read (read consistency under concurrent writes).
recommendations: Add 403/authorization-level tests: authenticated requests with insufficient permissions should return the correct error (403) and descriptive message.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests to assert 429 behavior or documented throttling policy and verify backoff headers (Retry-After) if applicable.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers are present and conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) return 304 when appropriate.
Add malformed-type tests for numeric query parameters: offset=abc, limit=one, extremely large integers, and non-ASCII input to assert 400/422 handling.
Clarify and test matching semantics: add tests for case-sensitivity, partial/substring match vs exact match for fieldName and fieldValue, and document expected behavior in API docs.
Verify pagination defaults and caps: add tests that omit limit to assert default=100, and test server-enforced maximum limit if applicable (e.g., limit > maxLimit returns error or is clamped).
Add Content-Type and Accept header tests: ensure responses respect Accept header (application/json) and include proper Content-Type; validate charset if required.
Add method-rejection tests: ensure non-GET methods are rejected with 405 and proper Allow header.
Add read-consistency tests under concurrent writes: simulate concurrent updates/inserts while searching to confirm stable/expected behavior (snapshot/consistency model).

Document and automate performance thresholds used in performance tests and add assertions around error codes under overload to distinguish degradation vs failure (e.g., when to expect 503 vs 200 with slow responses).
